intro: Fagara chiloperone var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fagara, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
